intro: Biscutella laevigata proles controversa, commonly known as the wrinkled biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
